A basic motif of the Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] molecules (not including solvents), with partial labeling scheme provided (green - Ni, blue - N, grey - C).

2-D square grid network form by tetracyanonickelate molecules and the bridging CN group (green - Ni, blue - N, grey - C).

(a) Framework structure of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] showing the 2D nets connected by the bpene ligands to form a 3D network (green - Ni, blue - N, grey - C); (b) polyhedral view of the octahedral and square-planar coordination environments in Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4].

elements.content: 212223(a) and (b) Structure of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] illustrating examples of two possible arrangements of the free and coordinated bpene ligands.10A parallel view of the tunnel in Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4]·½bpene·DMSO·2H2O showing the entrapped free ligands, and disordered DMSO molecules (a) and (b).(a) and (b) The “resolved” configurations of the disordered DMSO molecules with symmetry codes (a) x, 1/2 − y, z, (b) x, 3/2 − y, z.8824Schematic drawing demonstrating the opening/collapsing (decreasing/increasing β angle) of the monoclinic unit cells of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] as previously proposed by Culp et al.88Molecular structure of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] (without solvent), with van der Waals exclusion volume of all atoms16 shown by colored spheres. elements.content: 16Pore Size Distribution (PSD) of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] as a function of local pore diameter, as calculated by the method of Gelb and Gubbins15 and described in the text. The solid black line is the PSD for the material with only the bound bpene ligands (i.e., the free ligands in the pore channels have been removed) and the solid red line is the PSD for the material with all bpene ligands present.
elements.clean_text:
16

Pore Size Distribution (PSD) of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] as a function of local pore diameter, as calculated by the method of Gelb and Gubbins15 and described in the text. The solid black line is the PSD for the material with only the bound bpene ligands (i.e., the free ligands in the pore channels have been removed) and the solid red line is the PSD for the material with all bpene ligands present.

elements.content: 151819258Normalized TGA curves measured in air for various [Ni(bpene)Ni(CN)4-(guests)] samples. (A) Single crystals with guest H2O, DMSO, and bpene; (B) polycrystalline sample after vacuum drying at RT for 18 h with guests DMSO and bpene; (C) air-dried polycrystalline sample after extraction with acetone, then toluene; (D) polycrystalline sample C after further extraction with acetone; (E) polycrystalline sample D after vacuum drying at 90 °C overnight.

Atomic positions were obtained via the crystallographic information from this work. (a) Structure without free bpene ligands. (b) Structure with free bpene ligands. Color codes for atoms: cyan, C; blue, N; white, H; green, Ni.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 10 Pore Size Distribution (PSD) of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] as a function of local pore diameter, as calculated by the method of Gelb and Gubbins15 and described in the text. The solid black line is the PSD for the material with only the bound bpene ligands (i.e., the free ligands in the pore channels have been removed) and the solid red line is the PSD for the material with all bpene ligands present.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 10  Pore Size Distribution (PSD) of Ni(bpene)[Ni(CN)4] as a function of local pore diameter, as calculated by the method of Gelb and Gubbins15 and described in the text. The solid black line is the PSD for the material with only the bound bpene ligands (i.e., the free ligands in the pore channels have been removed) and the solid red line is the PSD for the material with all bpene ligands present.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 11 Normalized TGA curves measured in air for various [Ni(bpene)Ni(CN)4-(guests)] samples. (A) Single crystals with guest H2O, DMSO, and bpene; (B) polycrystalline sample after vacuum drying at RT for 18 h with guests DMSO and bpene; (C) air-dried polycrystalline sample after extraction with acetone, then toluene; (D) polycrystalline sample C after further extraction with acetone; (E) polycrystalline sample D after vacuum drying at 90 °C overnight.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 11  Normalized TGA curves measured in air for various [Ni(bpene)Ni(CN)4-(guests)] samples. (A) Single crystals with guest H2O, DMSO, and bpene; (B) polycrystalline sample after vacuum drying at RT for 18 h with guests DMSO and bpene; (C) air-dried polycrystalline sample after extraction with acetone, then toluene; (D) polycrystalline sample C after further extraction with acetone; (E) polycrystalline sample D after vacuum drying at 90 °C overnight.

metadata.title: Improved synthesis and crystal structure of the flexible pillared layer porous coordination polymer: Ni(1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethylene)[Ni(CN) 4 ]
